Our Priorities

While others are focused on the politics of the past, Dezmond is focused on the possibilities of our future. He isn't coming from a boardroom — he's coming from a classroom, grounded in real-world experience and community needs.

Community First

District 1 Protection Plan

Dezmond will establish a District 1 Protection Plan to safeguard what makes our community strong by:

  • Strengthening the Rural Legacy Program to preserve farmland and open space
  • Expanding agricultural easements to protect rural property values and family-owned land
  • Ensuring taxpayer dollars stay in the community — funding schools, public safety, and essential infrastructure instead of unnecessary litigation

The Next Generation Guarantee

The Next Generation Guarantee is about securing the future of our students while strengthening the long-term stability of our community. To do that, we must move beyond the siloed relationship between the Board of Commissioners and the Board of Education and build a true partnership rooted in shared accountability.

Dezmond's Next Generation Guarantee closes the gap between county leadership and the classroom through a comprehensive, results-driven approach that includes:

  • A joint strategic oversight model
  • Teacher incentives
  • Expanding rural high-speed education access
  • Workforce-linked schools that prepare students for real opportunities right here at home

Honoring the Frontline

In District 1, public safety isn't just a budget line item; it's the difference between life and death across our district and county. Right now, our Sheriff's Office and local EMS face serious staffing challenges as we lose experienced professionals to neighboring counties.

Dezmond believes it's time to move from being a training ground for other jurisdictions to becoming a true destination for dedicated public safety professionals who are supported, retained, and valued right here in our community.

Preserving Our Rural Character

Dezmond is committed to protecting our community from unchecked data center development by putting residents first. If data centers come to Charles County, he will:

  • Require strong Community Benefit Agreements to ensure local families see real returns
  • Enforce an infrastructure-first mandate so no major development moves forward without roads that work and schools with capacity
  • Expand PDR and TDR programs to protect farmland and direct growth to appropriate corridors
  • Require permanent environmental audits for large projects to safeguard our communities from flooding and climate-related risks

Honest Planning & Healthy Communities

Honest Planning, Healthy Communities means listening to residents who are already feeling the strain of traffic congestion along MD-210 and US-301 and refusing to approve more rooftops until real solutions — like funded road expansions or the Southern Maryland Rapid Transit (SMRT) project — are in place.

For families across District 1, honest planning also means building communities where health is the easy choice, by:

  • Addressing food deserts in western and southern parts of the county
  • Creating walkable, mixed-use hubs so residents aren't car-dependent for every errand
  • Bringing high-quality jobs to Charles County, ensuring our young people can build their futures at home instead of commuting to D.C. or Virginia to find opportunity
